p: Viruses are infectious agents of small size and simple composition that can multiply only in living cells of animals, plants, or bacteria. All viruses contain a nucleic acid, either -DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) or -RNA (ribonucleic acid), and several proteins. Viruses should not even be considered organisms since they are not free-living ( i.e., they require a host cell), thus viruses need to elude the host immune defense to infect its cells in order to reproduce and survive. [ 54].
